text:
Hi Team,

Struggling to get a connection from my Validator to the Scan address. I can generate my onboarding secret, so I'm not sure it's a whitelisting issue. It appears I'm receiving HTML in response to my requests with the scan address from the /api/scan/version endpoint.
```Unsupported Content-Type [Some(text/html)], supported: application/json```
I have been told to use this scan/sponsor endpoint by <@U04KJF6UTNU>:
```<https://sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/>```
But I also tried running a curl against
```<https://sv.sv-1.dev.global.canton.network.sync.global>```
And received the same error.

I have noticed that the URL provided (sv.sv-2) does not exist in the All DevNet Super Validator Nodes page. The nearest one is this:
```<https://scan.sv-2-eng.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>```
Could I have been given the wrong URL?

I'm a bit stuck at the moment so would appreciate some help.

elements.text:
Hi Team,

Struggling to get a connection from my Validator to the Scan address. I can generate my onboarding secret, so I'm not sure it's a whitelisting issue. It appears I'm receiving HTML in response to my requests with the scan address from the /api/scan/version endpoint.
I have been told to use this scan/sponsor endpoint by
But I also tried running a curl against

And received the same error.

I have noticed that the URL provided (sv.sv-2) does not exist in the All DevNet Super Validator Nodes page. The nearest one is this:

Could I have been given the wrong URL?

text:
Hi
Please use this guide to check the whitelist for the DevNet: <https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_onboarding.html#validating-that-your-ip-has-been-approved|https://docs.dev.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_onboarding.html#validating-that-your-ip-has-been-approved>

To join the network, you need to be whitelisted by the majority of SVs (12+ for the DevNet as of now)

You can check all available scan URLs per network here: <https://sync.global/sv-network/|https://sync.global/sv-network/>

text:
To confirm, the scanAddress in validator-values.yaml should be:

```<https://sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/api/sv/version>```

elements.text: To confirm, the scanAddress in validator-values.yaml should be:

text:
scan address starts with the `scan.`
"Sponsor address" starts with the `sv.`

<@U01DARYACCT> - I tried adding /api/sv/version to the end of my scanAddress and then just appended `/api/scan/version` so the GET request looked like this:
```GET <https://sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/api/sv/version/api/scan/version>```
<@UUT0L5W2J> - The issue I'm having is that when my validator tries to reach back, it's giving me this error:
```Unsupported Content-Type [Some(text/html)], supported: application/json```
My validator-values.yaml page states this:
`<https://sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com>`
It is then auto-appending `/api/scan/version` which then returns HTTP content where it appears to be expecting JSON content, which I think is leading to the error.

elements.text: - I tried adding /api/sv/version to the end of my scanAddress and then just appended
so the GET request looked like this:
- The issue I'm having is that when my validator tries to reach back, it's giving me this error:
which then returns HTTP content where it appears to be expecting JSON content, which I think is leading to the error.

text:
I just tried running `curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" -s <https://scan.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/api/sv/version>` 
And it gave me HTML again

elements.text: And it gave me HTML again

:tada: Splice release `0.4.9` is ready for deployment on DevNet, and is available from the GSF
:ship: ⅔ of Super Validator nodes have upgraded to this release, including the GSF Super Validator node
*SV node status here*: <https://sync.global/sv-network>
*Release notes here*: <https://docs.dev.sync.global/release_notes.html>
